review_title: A brilliant Charity, Outstanding service, amazing staff and fascinating people to work with!
job_title: Chief Executive Officer (CEO) in Chatham, England
pros: today I was told by new staff on induction that what we say is what we do! they described staff and services as very helpful and supportive and services as progressive, innovative and outstanding!
cons: I have not received recommendations today but as a service we are not perfect but will take complaints and concerns as a positive opportunity to improve and excell!

pros: The service users are all brilliant
cons: Poor management, low pay, no recognition, unsociable hours

pros: I feel that KAT is the most authentic and genuinely caring organisation I have worked for, and I hear other staff saying this too. I remember feeling like this when I first started and more than 10 years later, I still feel that KAT is different from other care providers. I consistently see staff working with people we support in an amazing way.
cons: Working with a lot of people may always mean encountering some negativity or some staff not understanding the approach with people we support, but hopefully we can always work well together. Staff have so much knowledge and skill for so little pay in comparison to other fields. It is so unfair. But not the fault of the company who always increase wages and benefits wherever they can.

job_title: Human Resources Officer in Brompton, South East England, England
pros: Development, work-life balance, constructive reviews to help with developments and CPD. Great team ethos. With a family friendly work culture.
cons: Parking at HQ can be limited.

job_title: Support Worker in Ashford, Kent, South East England, England
pros: It was good, no two days are the same.
cons: Some unfriendly staff at the place of work.

job_title: Specialist Support Worker in Chatham, England
cons: Clicky, unprofessional, reporting procedure a joke, lazy staff, uncaring lazy management

job_title: Support Worker in Ashford, Kent, South East England, England
pros:
- A great sense of community 
- Person centred approach 
- Daily challenges - everyday is different
- Fantastic support from Managers and your team
cons:
- Not the greatest pay for what you’re doing but pretty good with regards to care work.
- Hours and shift patterns - but it depends on your personal life responsibilities.
stressful, high energy, flexible thinking and forever changing
